results.title: Signs of trouble. Aspects of delinquency. Ep. 2. We hate school (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Gordon Croton and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Truancy and disruptive behaviour at school are on the increase. This program looks at the causes and possible solutions. This second part of the series, Signs of Trouble, was shot in Britain and the USA, and introduced by Laurie Taylor, Professor of Sociology at the University of York.

results.title: Signs of Life (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Brisbane College of Advanced Education AV Prod Unit
results.brief_description: The Australian Deaf Community has been an unknown and misunderstood minority group for far too long. In this lively, informative video, the stereotypes are blown away. Here we see deaf people leading normal, purposeful lives, participating in a wide range of activities which their thriving community supports and talking about their lives with inspiring candour, insight and humour.

results.title: Signs for safety
results.brief_description: Describes clearly the different road signs and their meanings. Divides them into four classes - regulatory, warning, information, and temporary devices. In the Materials Research Laboratory, C.R.B. head office, signs are tested for efficiency, durability and reflecting power. Stresses the need for motorists to recognise and obey the signs.

results.title: Significance tests
results.creator_credit: Jill Singer, David Huntley, Peggy Girshman, COMAP and Chedd-Angier Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 20 of Series “Against all odds: inside statistics”.
Describes the basic reasoning behind tests of significance. The concept if a null hypothesis is explained, and it is shown how a z-test is carried out when the hypothesis concerns the mean of a normal population with known standard deviation. Hosted by Teresa Amabile.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jill Singer, David Huntley, Peggy Girshman, COMAP and Chedd-Angier Productions
results.description:

results.title: Signatures of the Soul
results.brief_description: Counter-cultural icon Peter Fonda takes us on a comprehensive journey through the world of tattooing. From early tribal origins and eastern influences, right through to adoption in the mainstream and gradual acceptance as an art form, tattooing has been elevated to both art and an intense form of self-expression.
results.description: Counter-cultural icon Peter Fonda takes us on a comprehensive journey through the world of tattooing. From early tribal origins and eastern influences, right through to adoption in the mainstream and gradual acceptance as an art form, tattooing has been elevated to both art and an intense form of self-expression.

results.title: Signals without words
results.creator_credit: Ken J. Widdowson and Educational Media
results.brief_description: Deals with nonverbal communication in humans and animals. Shows the many ways by which humans and animals communicate without using words — including facial expressions, body posture, gestures, dress, and sounds.

results.title: Signals : nerves of the army
results.creator_credit: Bruce Christie, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: During the war, without communication, the soldiers were sitting ducks. Signalmen, like Bruce Christie, may not have been on the front line, but, as Bruce illustrates, their role was just as crucial to the war.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Christie, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
